mpu9250_driver.ak8963 module

class mpu9250_driver.ak8963.AK8963(bus, address, nav_frame='NED', hz=100)[source]

Bases: object

AK8963 I2C driver for acquire magnetometer data

Parameters:

  • bus (SMBus) – device I2C port

  • address (int) – AK8963 I2C address

  • nav_frame (str) – navigation frame

  • hz (int) – IMU frequency

config_AK8963(bit)[source]

Config AK8963 magnetometer mode

Parameters:

bit (int) – accelerometer configuration register value

get_adjust_mag()[source]

AK8963 sensitivity adjustment value for xyz axis

get_mag()[source]

AK8963 magnetometer data in Earth’s reference (µT)

ENU:

mx is positive when the right hand side pointing to north

my is positive when the front side pointing to north

mz is positive when the upper side pointing to north

NED:

mx is positive when the front side pointing to north

my is positive when the right hand side pointing to north

mz is positive when the under side pointing to north

Returns:

  • mx (float) - x-axis magnetometer data in µT

  • my (float) - y-axis magnetometer data in µT

  • mz (float) - z-axis magnetometer data in µT

get_status()[source]

Check AK8963 magnetometer status

read_raw_data(high_register, low_register)[source]

Access the high and low registers of the magnetometer to calculate their values into int16 format

Parameters:

  • high_register (int) – high registers of the magnetometer

  • low_register (int) – low registers of the magnetometer

Returns:

  • signed_value (int) - sensor value in int16 format

set_mode(mode, bit)[source]

AK8963 CNTL1 register configuration

Parameters:

  • mode (bool) – operation mode setting

  • bit (int) – output bit setting

who_am_i()[source]

Check AK8963 WHOAMI register value

mpu9250_driver.mpu6500 module

class mpu9250_driver.mpu6500.MPU6500(bus, address, nav_frame='ENU', hz=100)[source]

Bases: object

MPU6500 I2C driver for acquire accelerometer and gyroscope data

Parameters:

  • bus (SMBus) – device I2C port

  • address (int) – MPU6500 I2C address

  • nav_frame (str) – navigation frame

  • hz (int) – IMU frequency

config_MPU6500(accel_parameter, gyro_parameter)[source]

Config MPU6500 accelerometer and gyroscope scale with internal DMP

Parameters:

  • accel_parameter (int) – accelerometer configuration register value

  • gyro_parameter (int) – gyroscope configuration register value

control_accel_gyro(ax=True, ay=True, az=True, gx=True, gy=True, gz=True)[source]

Whether to enable accelerometer and gyroscope xyz axis data

Parameters:

  • ax (bool) – enable x axis accelerometer data

  • ay (bool) – enable y axis accelerometer data

  • az (bool) – enable z axis accelerometer data

  • gx (bool) – enable x axis gyroscope data

  • gy (bool) – enable y axis gyroscope data

  • gz (bool) – enable z axis gyroscope data

get_accel()[source]

MPU6500 accelerometer data in Earth’s reference (m/s^2) Accelerometer channel is negative when pointing up and aligned against gravity

ENU:

Gravity is defined as negative when pointing upward

ax = +9.80665 m/s^2 when the right hand side pointing upward

ay = +9.80665 m/s^2 when front side pointing upward

az = +9.80665 m/s^2 when upper side pointing upward

NED: Gravity is defined as negative when pointing downward

ax = +9.80665 m/s^2 when front side pointing downward

ay = +9.80665 m/s^2 when the right hand side pointing downward

az = +9.80665 m/s^2 when under side pointing upward

Returns:

  • ax (float) - x-axis accelerometer data in m/s^2

  • ay (float) - y-axis accelerometer data in m/s^2

  • az (float) - z-axis accelerometer data in m/s^2

get_gyro()[source]

MPU6500 gyroscope data in right hand coordinates (rad/s)

ENU:

gx is positive when rotate clockwise along x-axis

gy is positive when rotate clockwise along y-axis

gz is positive when rotate anti-clockwise along z-axis

NED:

gx is positive when rotate clockwise along x-axis

gy is positive when rotate clockwise along y-axis

gz is positive when rotate clockwise along z-axis

Returns:

  • gx (float) - x-axis gyroscope data in rad/s

  • gy (float) - y-axis gyroscope data in rad/s

  • gz (float) - z-axis gyroscope data in rad/s

get_temp()[source]

MPU6500 temperature data

Returns:

  • temp (float) - temperature data in °C

gyro_calibration(s: int)[source]

Calculate the gyroscope offset to calibrate the gyroscope

Parameters:

s (int) – time for calibration

read_raw_data(high_register, low_register)[source]

Access the high and low registers of the accelerometer and gyroscope to calculate their values into int16 format

Parameters:

  • high_register (int) – high registers of the accelerometer or gyroscope

  • low_register (int) – low registers of the accelerometer or gyroscope

Returns:

  • signed_value (int) - sensor value in int16 format

who_am_i()[source]

Check MPU6500 WHOAMI register value

mpu9250_driver.mpu9250 module

class mpu9250_driver.mpu9250.MPU9250(nav_frame, axis, hz, s)[source]

Bases: object

MPU9250 I2C driver for accessing MPU6500 and AK8963 [1] [2]

Parameters:

  • nav_frame (str) – navigation frame

  • axis (int) – axis data

  • hz (float) – IMU frequency

  • s (float) – calibration time

[1]

MPU-9250 Product Specification <https://invensense.tdk.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/PS-MPU-9250A-01-v1.1.pdf>

[2]

MPU-9250 Register Map and Descriptions <https://invensense.tdk.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/RM-MPU-9250A-00-v1.6.pdf>

check_i2c_address()[source]

Search all I2C addresses and record accessible addresses

Returns:

  • address_list (list) - stores a list of all accessible I2C addresses

get_accel()[source]

MPU9250 accelerometer data in Earth’s reference (m/s^2) Accelerometer channel is negative when pointing up and aligned against gravity

ENU:

Gravity is defined as negative when pointing upward

ax = +9.80665 m/s^2 when the right hand side pointing upward

ay = +9.80665 m/s^2 when front side pointing upward

az = +9.80665 m/s^2 when upper side pointing upward

NED:

Gravity is defined as negative when pointing downward

ax = +9.80665 m/s^2 when front side pointing downward

ay = +9.80665 m/s^2 when the right hand side pointing downward

az = +9.80665 m/s^2 when under side pointing upward

Returns:

  • ax (float) - x-axis accelerometer data in m/s^2

  • ay (float) - y-axis accelerometer data in m/s^2

  • az (float) - z-axis accelerometer data in m/s^2

get_ahrs_euler()[source]

MPU9250 Euler angle processed by AHRS

Returns:

  • roll (float) - x-axis Euler angle in degree

  • pitch (float) - y-axis Euler angle in degree

  • yaw (float) - z-axis Euler angle in degree

Returns:

  • x (float) - Quaternion X axis

  • y (float) - Quaternion Y axis

  • z (float) - Quaternion Z axis

NED:

gx is positive when rotate clockwise along x-axis

MPU9250 magnetometer data in Earth’s reference (µT)

ENU:

mx is positive when the right hand side pointing to north

my is positive when the front side pointing to north

mz is positive when the upper side pointing to north

NED:

mx is positive when the front side pointing to north

my is positive when the right hand side pointing to north

mz is positive when the under side pointing to north
